definition: to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])
surname Mao

sentences.english: Conversely, mathematical structures have an eerily real feel to them.
sentences.chinese: 反過來說，數學結構也具有令人發毛的真實感。

sentences.english: Barcelona are becoming obsessed with and terrified by Madrid and Mourinho.
sentences.chinese: 巴薩被皇馬和穆里尼奧盯得心裏發毛。

sentences.english: Being alone in that gloomy house gave me the willies .
sentences.chinese: 我一個人在那所陰暗的房子心裏就發毛。

sentences.english: You will find that the only thing you feared is the unknown.
sentences.chinese: 你會知道讓你發毛的事情根本不存在。

definition: lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
bird's nest
unable to sit or stand still (out of nervousness etc) (idiom)
lit. heart alarmed, body leaping (idiom); fear and trepidation in the face of disaster
to swell up/swelling
to feel numb
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
audible
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
cheerful and optimistic/in a good mood/gaily
dispirited and downcast (idiom); listless/in low spirits/washed out
to turn tears into laughter (idiom); to turn grief into happiness
